title: Support pub_date fallback for translation articles
Improve error recovery when serving
body:
When a build error occured, the `watch_build` function would exit its watching loop and exit on error.

Instead, this PR makes it print the error, and continue to be able to recover.

This is a partial correction of #126 , the `panic!` call on date formatting still let the `serve` in a bad state

title: Improve locating root zine folder
body:
I have improved the locating root zine folder process. 

Here are two major changes:
- Reuse the zine instance for the first building.
- Make the parse TOML error more fine-grain, this is helpful to error diagnose.

  The user can know it is due to lacking root `zine.toml` or it's an invalid format root `zine.toml`.
  ```
  Error: Invalid format of root `zine.toml`: missing field `url` for key `site` at line 21 column 1

  Caused by:
    missing field `url` for key `site` at line 21 column 1
  ```

Also, I'm not sure whether we should join the `dest` with the `source` path or not. Cc. @silentEAG

title: Support find zine folder recursively
body: It would allow users to execute commands in any subdirectory. #25

title: Fix markdown visitor not fallback to origin tag
body:
We should fall back to the original tag if the downstream return no custom `Event`.

```diff
Event::Start(tag) => v.visit_start_tag(&tag)
+  .or(Some(Event::Start(tag))),
Event::End(tag) => v.visit_end_tag(&tag)
+. .or(Some(Event::End(tag))),
```

Rename Season to Issue
body:
According to the [Periodical literature Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Periodical_literature) page, the correct and formal terminology is **issue**, rather than **season**. 😅

Since Zine hasn't reached 1.0 yet, the breaking changes are within expectations. However, these breaking changes have little effect on the user. The migration step is pretty simple,  only a rename from `[[season]]` to `[[issue]]` is needed.
```diff
- [[season]]
+ [[issue]]
slug = "s"
number = 1
...
```

title: Rewrite html base url
body:
This PR is mainly to fix https://github.com/zineland/zine/issues/11. 

Instead of adding a `public_url`, we rewrite all root paths with the base URL 
if the base URL isn't a naked domain. For instance, if the `site_url` is a Github 
Pages URL, such as `https://zineland.github.io/zine`, the `/hello.css` link would
be rewritten to `https://zineland.github.io/zine/hello.css`. For naked domain URLs, 
we do nothing.

The benefit is we bring no extra concepts to the user, for example, the user 
doesn't need to learn what the `public_url` is, this keeps zine as simple and 
intuitive as possible.

title: Avoid unnecessary articles serializations
body: Replace the `featured()` tera function with concrete featured articles argument

title: Speed up parsing and rendering
body:
This PR aims to speed up parsing and rendering by using `rayon` and tokio spawn blocking task.

A simple build time cost comparation (microseconds):
## before:
- debug: 1242431, 1471965
- release: 17792, 19198

## after:
- debug: 1043317, 1113345
- release: 7912, 9150
